abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration announces city will join Justice Dept's Strong Cities Network program for identifying and stopping terrorist recruitment efforts across country; American Muslim advocates have raised concerns about program, as have civil rights lawyers, as they say it focuses inordinately on law-abiding American Muslims and their activities.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio decided at the last minute to support the program, the Strong Cities Network, in a speech at a United Nations forum, despite objections by American Muslim organizations.

headline.main: New York City to Join U.S. Anti-Terrorist Program Criticized by Rights Groups
headline.print_headline: City Joins U.S. in Plan to Fight the Recruiting of Terrorists

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio decided at the last minute to support the program, the Strong Cities Network, in a speech at a United Nations forum, despite objections by American Muslim organizations.
